title: The Dream - the speaker arrives at a resolution

content.prompt: By the end of the poem, the speaker arrives at which of the following resolutions to his dilemma?

choices.label: Love is not worth all the suffering it entails.
Sense and reason are often aligned with love.
Love and truth are preferable to fantasy and dream.
The joys of love are too brief and illusory to be valued.

skill.text: Skill 1.A: Identify and describe what specific textual details reveal about a character, that character's perspective, and that character's motives.
